Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a corrective action plan is required. The corrective action
plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter, must be completed and routed in CWLM,
and must include the following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & COF Rule 400.10177 Resident restraint.
Section (1) The facility shall establish and follow written policy and
Description procedures specifying the use of resident restraint.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth A (16) is currently in foster care and was recently placed at
the Ottawa Co Juvenile Detention Center about a week ago. Staff
1 is a staff member at the facility. Last night, Youth A was being
restrained because he was trying to leave. Staff 1 grabbed ahold
of Youth A and Youth A tried to choke Staff 1 and scratch his eye
out. Staff 1 then flung Youth A across the room and Youth A hit
the stool to his desk. Youth A was examined by the nurse in the
facility, and he was determined not to have been injured. The
incident is currently under investigation at the facility.
Investigation Administrator 1 was interviewed via phone on 2/18/2025. He
reported having no further information to provide about the
incident. He also reported learning about the situation while
reviewing the video of the restraint of Youth A by Staff 1. He
reported observing inappropriate techniques by Staff 1 and that
Youth A also was attacking other staff.
Administrator 1 and Administrator 2 were interviewed face-to-
face at the facility on 2/19/2025. They reported Youth A was
placed at the facility on 2/10/25 and is scheduled to be removed
from the facility later today. They also reported not receiving
information on the mental health issues Youth A presented with
when being placed at the facility. This included not receiving
medication that Youth A was prescribed at the time of placement.
They reported observing the video recording of the restraint and
finding that Staff 1 pushed Youth A back into Youth A’s room
which is not a technique used in the approved behavior
management program. They also reported Youth A claimed to be
paralyzed but never showed symptoms of this following the
restraint. However, Youth A is reported to have a history of back
issues from an accident.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
2/19/2025. Youth A reported understanding the reason for this
interview and that the incident began when Youth A was
2

restrained for barricading the pod door. Youth A also reported
hearing voices because Youth A has “schizophrenia”. Youth A
reported receiving this diagnosis during one of his hospitalizations.
Youth A also reported being brought to his room where staff were
leaving Youth A’s room when Youth A rushed staff. Youth A
reported Staff 1 opened the door and pushed Youth A back into
the room where Youth A then struck his back against the stool in
the room. Youth A also reported a belief that Staff 1 shoved Youth
A directly at the stool and Youth A would have been alright if he
had not hit the stool. Youth A based this belief on Youth A’s
perception of the angel Youth A was shoved. Youth A reported
being paralyzed and having no feeling below Youth A’s waist.
Youth A also reported “begging” for assistance and having staff
ignore Youth A’s request. Youth A was unable to identify the
names of the other staff present but believed these staff would go
along with whatever Staff 1 reported because Staff 1 was the
supervisor at the time and told the staff to just shut the door.
Youth A also reported having to pull Youth A up by Youth A’s
arms because Youth A could not move his legs. Youth A reported
this occurred around 7:00 pm and the nurse did not observe Youth
A until around 10:00 pm. Youth A reported the nurse touched his
toes and the bottom of Youth A's feet before “just leaving”. Youth
A also reported urinating on Youth A and had to stay that way until
third shift and Staff 2 came into the unit. Youth A reported Staff 2
provided a change of clothing and gave Youth A, a rag to wipe off
Youth A’s legs. Youth A also reported being given a new mattress
and new blanket at the same time. Youth A reported believing that
Youth A needs to be in the hospital because of the voices and
reported the facility has kept Youth A on Youth A’s medication
since receiving the medication a day after being admitted.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
2/19/2025. He reported Youth A had been acting out for several
days prior to the incident outlined in the allegation. Staff 1 also
reported Youth A was on restrictions because of inappropriate
behavior. Staff 1 reported Youth A was placed in Pod E alone to
help Youth A calm down because of struggles with other youth.
Staff 1 also reported Youth A began to pound on the windows of
the Pod and asked Staff 1 to come into the Pod. Staff 1 reported
observing Youth A on the camera and through the window which
was connected to the control room where Staff 1 was located.
Staff 1 also reported Youth A would go into the shower area out of
site of the camera view so Staff 1 would instruct Youth A to return
to the central Pod area. Staff 1 reported going into the Pod to
speak with Youth A and finding Youth A “excited but not fighting”.
Staff 1 also reported being physically attacked by Youth A 2-days
3

prior to this incident when Youth A slapped and punched Staff 1.
Once on the Pod with Youth A, Youth A picked up a trash can and
attempted to strike Staff 1 with the trash can, but Staff 1 reported
being able to block the can. Once blocking the trash can, Youth A
escalated, and Staff 1 reported telling Youth A to go to Youth A’s
room. Youth A began to resist so Staff 1 asked for assistance.
Staff 3, Staff 4, and Staff 5 responded and Staff 3 and Staff 5 each
grabbed onto a foot of Youth A. Staff 1 and Staff 4 then picked up
Youth A and moved Youth A to Youth A’s bedroom. Once in the
room Staff 1 reported Youth A punched Staff 4. Staff 1 also
reported all staff left the room except for Staff 4 who was holding
Youth A on the floor. Staff 1 reported Staff 4 let Youth A go and
rushed to get out of the room. Youth A was able to get a leg and
arm out of the door before the door could be closed. Staff 1 was
using his foot to keep the door from opening any wider when
Youth A attempted to grab Staff 1’s eyes. Staff 1 reported Staff 3,
Staff 4, and Staff 5 opened the door and Staff 1 stepped into the
room. Staff 1 also reported once in the room, pushing Youth A
back into the room so Staff 1 could exit the room and shut the
door. Staff 1 reported Youth A slipped when stepping backwards
and hit Youth A’s hit on the stool which caused Youth A to yell.
Staff 1 also reported Youth A was yelling that Youth A could not
move Youth A’s legs, so Staff 1 called the nurse. Staff 1 reported
having Staff 4 go outside and look inside of the window to the
bedroom. Staff 1 also reported Staff 4 informed Staff 1, that Youth
A was standing and walked around the room before sitting down
on the bed. Staff 1 reported observing the nurse check Youth A
and when entering the room finding Youth A laying on the bed.
Youth A had urinated on himself. The nurse asked Youth A to lay
on Youth A’s back and he rolled over on his back. The nurse also
checked Youth A for feeling in his feet and Youth A had feeling in
his feet. The third shift staff provided a cleaning clothing for Youth
A to change into. Staff 1 reported he should not have picked up
Youth A and moved Youth A to the bedroom because it is against
what staff are taught in physical management. Staff 1 also
reported pushing Youth A was not an approved technique and he
should not have taken that action either. Staff 1 reported he
should have given Youth A, a few minutes to calm down and not
made going to Youth A’s room the primary issue. Staff 1 also
reported feeling remorseful and plans to avoid this type of action
in the future.
Staff 3 was interviewed via phone on 2/24/2025. She reported
remembering the incident outlined in the allegations and reported
being present for the incident. She reported not remembering if
Youth A was carried to Youth A’s room but did remember
4

grabbing Youth A’s leg to support Staff 1 and Staff 4 who were
holding Youth A’s torso. She also reported remembering Youth A
attempting to get out of Youth A’s room but didn’t have a clear
view since she was standing in the back of the Pod. She denied
observing anything that occurred in the room but did report Youth
A complained of back pain, therefore Nurse was called. She
reported Youth A claimed he could not move his legs but after an
assessment by Nurse, it was determined Youth A had not lost the
use of Youth A’s legs.
Nurse was interviewed via phone on 2/24/2025. She reported
remembering being called by staff (unable to recall which staff)
that Youth A was claiming Youth A was unable to move and was
paralyzed from the waist down. She also reported when arriving
on the Pod she was told it was unsafe to visit with Youth A alone
in the room because of his violent behaviors. She reported
attempting to view Youth A from the outside window but was
unable to do so because of her height. She also reported
speaking to Youth A through the window in the door of the room
and having Youth A assure her that Youth A would not be
aggressive or violent with her. After going into the room, asking
Youth A what had happened and having Youth A tell her that Staff
1 kneeled on Youth A with Staff 1’s “fat ass”. She also reported
Youth A rolled over and was soaked in urine. She reported Youth
A denied being in pain and used Youth A’s own strength to lift
Youth A’s legs. She assessed Youth A’s reflexes were all intact.
She did not observe any injuries on Youth A and believed there
would be muscle or neurology issues if Youth A had been roughed
up but there was nothing present.
Staff 2 was interviewed via phone on 2/25/2025. He reported
working 3rd shift and when arriving at the facility on the day of the
incident was informed by Staff 1 of the incident with Youth A. He
also reported Staff 1 stated Youth A was in Youth A’s room and
had urinated on Youth A and claimed to be paralyzed again. After
the shift changed, Staff 2 spoke with Youth A and offered Youth A
to take a shower, which Youth A refused. Staff 2 reported
providing a washcloth to Youth A to clean up along with a change
of clothing and Youth A’s mattress. Staff 2 also reported Youth A
was moving around and able to place the mattress under Youth A.
Staff 2 reported Nurse assessed Youth A prior to Staff 2’s arrival
at the facility.
Staff 5 was interviewed via phone on 2/25/2025. She reported
being part of the staff that engaged in the restraint of Youth A
outlined in the allegations. She also reported Staff 1 was the
5

acting supervisor on the shift at the time. She reported Staff 1 told
her to stay out of the pod while Staff 1 and Staff 4 engaged in the
restraint, but Staff 5 believed they were taught to have 4 staff
involved in this type of restraint. She also reported staff are trained
not to carry a youth, as Staff 1 and Staff 4 did, as part of the
behavior management techniques and pushing a youth is not part
of the physical management. She reported that once in the room
Youth A got Youth A’s legs loose and Staff 5 and Staff 3 again
gained control of Youth A’s legs. When the staff (Staff 1, Staff 3,
Staff 4, and Staff 5) attempted to leave the room, Youth A rushed
the door and blocked the door from being shut with Youth A’s
body and leg. Staff 5 reported Staff 1 told her to open the door
and Staff 1 pushed Youth A back into the room. She reported
hearing Youth A say Youth A was paralyzed and could not move.
She reported Nurse was called and came down to assess Youth A
about half an hour later. She reported Staff 1 said the restraint and
interaction went “sideways” during their talk afterwards.
Staff 4 was interviewed via phone on 2/28/2025. He reported
remembering the restraint of Youth A and being part of the
interaction. He also reported not knowing why the restraint was
initiated. He reported Youth A was trying to barricade the Pod
doors and once entering the room with Staff 1, Staff 4 reported
they attempted to de-escalate Youth A by talking to Youth A. He
reported Staff 1 and himself then grabbed Youth A and tried to
place Youth A in Youth A’s room. Youth A was fighting the
restraint by kicking, swinging, and biting at staff. Staff 4 reported
Staff 1, Staff 4, and one of the female staff (unable to identify this
staff by name) carried Youth A across the room to Youth A’s
bedroom. Staff 4 also reported being told by Staff 1 after the
incident that staff are not trained to carry youth. Staff 4 reported
not knowing if Staff 1 pushed Youth A into the room but was able
to get Youth A in the room so the door could be shut. Staff 4 also
reported going outside to “peek” on Youth A in the bedroom and
observing Youth A move from the floor to the bed even though
Youth A was yelling about being paralyzed.
Tour Observation:
A walk-through was completed in the facility and in the area of the
incident. This also included Youth A’s bedroom. The facility is
clean and well maintained along with having appropriate
furnishing.
6

Video Review:
The video recording is dated 2/16/25 at 7:18 with a view from
the ceiling onto the Pod. Youth A is observed in the view,
moving items (table and desk) placing them against the door
leading to the hallway. Staff 1 and Staff 4 enter the room and
move the items (tables) out of the way, walking into the Pod. Staff
1 and Staff 4 stand on the far side of the room with Youth A
standing on the other side of the room. Staff 1 moves to Youth A’s
bedroom. Opening the door to the bedroom before beginning to
move towards Youth A. Youth A moves quickly away from Staff 1
as Staff 4 moves towards Youth A from a different direction. Staff
1 and Staff 4 remove the items in front of the door as Youth A
picks up a small plastic trashcan and moves away from Staff 1
and Staff 4. Once again, Staff 1 and Staff 4 are at the opposite
end of the room before beginning to move towards Youth A. Staff
1 and Staff 4 come close to Youth A who turns Youth A’s back
towards Staff 1 and Staff 4. They appear to be talking before Staff
1 and Staff 4 move quickly, grabbing Youth A who dropped the
trashcan. Staff 1 and Staff 4 are holding Youth A who is struggling
as Staff 3 and Staff 5 enter the room and move towards Staff 1,
Staff 4, and Youth A. Staff 3 and Staff 5 each grab a leg of Youth
A. Staff 1 and Staff 4 each have an arm of Youth A, while Staff 3
continued to hold Youth A’s leg and Staff 5 let go of the leg to
remove obstacles in the way towards Youth A’s bedroom. This left
Staff 1 and Staff 4 each holding an arm and Staff 3 holding on leg.
Youth A continues to struggle and kick Youth A’s free leg. Youth A
is observed to be lifted off the ground and carried by Staff 1, Staff
3, and Staff 4. Once in the room Staff 1 and Staff 4 continued to
hold Youth A while Staff 3 and Staff 4 leave the room. Staff 3 and
Staff 5 come in and out of the room with Staff 3 remaining in the
room most of the time and Staff 5 standing near the bedroom
door. At one point, it appears Youth A moves from the bed to the
floor and Staff 5 engages in holding Youth A’s leg again before
coming out of the room. Staff 3 joins Staff 5 outside of the room
with Staff 3 holding the door open. Staff 1 and Staff 4 attempt to
leave the room but Youth A is observed getting Youth A’s arm and
leg between the closing door and door jam. Staff 3 opens the door
fully and Staff 1 appears to grab Youth A before pushing Youth A
back into the room. Staff 3 shuts the door and Staff 1, Staff 3,
Staff 4, and Staff 5 begin to walk away. The video recording ends.
7

Documents Reviewed:
Incident report for Youth A dated 2/16/25 @ 7:51 pm. This
document identifies the staff involved as Staff 1, Staff 3, Staff 4,
and Staff 5. This document indicates a “lockdown” was called at
7:19 pm because Youth A was barricading the entrance to the
Pod Youth A was currently in. It is also documented Staff 1 and
Staff 4 entered the Pod at 7:20 pm and began a restraint of Youth
A. Staff 3 and Staff 5 followed and assisted with the restraint. Staff
3 and Staff 5 held Youth A’s legs while Staff 1 and Staff 4 held
Youth A’s arms. It is documented that at approximately 7:21 pm
Youth A was placed in Youth A’s room, but Youth A was able to
get Youth A’s arms loose and began to “swing wildly and kick
Youth A’s legs. Staff 1 threw the mattress out of the room while
Staff 4 held Youth A on the floor so the other three staff (Staff 1,
Staff 3, and Staff 5) could exit the room. Youth A was able to stop
the door from being shut and pushed Youth A’s way out of the
room. It is documented Youth A grabbed Staff 1 around the neck
and tried to choke Staff 1 before Staff 1 broke the choke hold.
Youth A is then documented as attempting to place Youth A’s
fingers in Staff 1’s eyes. Staff 1 is documented as requesting Staff
4 to open the door and Staff 1 met Youth A in the doorway and
“assisted” Youth A back into the room. It is documented Staff 1
pushed Youth A back into the room and Youth A slipped hitting
Youth A’s hip/lower back on the pod stool. At 7:29 pm it is
documented Youth A was secure in Youth A’s room and was
heard to be squirming in pain. Youth A is documented as laying on
the floor saying Youth A was unable to move from the waist down.
Staff 1 then sent Staff 4 outside to observe Youth A from the
outside window and Staff 4 reported Youth A had gotten up and
sat on the bed. It is documented Administrator 2 was notified of
the incident at approximately 7:45 pm. This document has a
supplemental report by Staff 4 that was written at approximately
9:56 pm. Staff 4 documented the same actions in the incident
except for identifying that Staff 4 held on the right side of Youth A
and Staff 1 was on the left side of Youth A during the restraint.
Staff 4 also documented telling Staff 1, Youth A had gotten off the
floor and on to Youth A’s bed when looking through the outside
window. This document has a second supplemental report by
Staff 5 that was written at 10:50 pm. It is documented by Staff 5
that she arrived on the Pod and assisted Staff 1 and Staff 4 who
had begun to secure Youth A’s left and right arms. She
documents securing Youth A’s right leg before helping to place
Youth A in Youth A’s room. She also documents Staff 1 had to
replace Youth A into the room after Youth A attempted to run out
of the room. This report has a third supplemental report written by
8

Staff 3. She documents standing in the hallway observing Staff 1
and Staff 4 attempt to deescalate Youth A before Youth A hit Staff
1 with a trash can. She then entered the pod to assist with the
restraint by securing Youth A’s leg and assisting staff moving
Youth A to Youth A’s room. She documents the rest of the incident
in the initial report except for Youth A banging Youth A’s head on
the wall and seeking a pillow to keep Youth A from self-harm. She
also noted Youth A’s attempt to harm Staff 1 by grabbing at Staff
1’s face and neck area.
Nursing note for intake of Youth A on 2/11/2025. Youth A
reported lower back pain and had swelling/redness around L1/L2
area on right side along with an abrasion. Youth A reported a
hospital in Grand Rapids reported a belief Youth A was paralyzed
but was moving without issues. Youth A is documented as
refusing to answer intake questions.
Nursing note for intake of Youth A on 2/11/2025. Second
attempt to complete intake assessment, but Youth A continued to
refuse to answer questions.
Nursing note for intake of Youth A on 2/14/2025. Documented
health assessment was completed per facility protocol.
PA note for of Youth A on 2/14/2025. Documentation was
received and Youth A was involved in an accident on 2/8-2/9 and
evaluation in Emergency Room in Kalkaska. Also documented
Youth A left AMA and was then assessed after falling downstairs
at Munson Emergency Room. A CT was completed on Youth A
and results were negative for any lumbar spine fracture or
alignments. MRI was completed and was unremarkable without
evidence for cord compression or cord confusion. Youth A denied
any loss of movement.
Patient Note for Youth A written by Nurse on 2/16/25. It is
documented that Staff 1 contacted Nurse on 2/16/25 to inform her
staff had to go “hands on” with Youth A and Youth A is now
claiming Youth A is paralyzed from the waist down. This report
matches what Nurse reported during her interview.
PA note for of Youth A on 2/18/2025. Youth A is documented as
reporting no weakness of Youth A’s lower extremities and doing
well. He reported the restraint, and that Youth A was unable to
move after hitting the stool in Youth A’s room. He also reported
Nurse provided an assessment and given clean clothing after
losing control of urine. It is documented the PA has some concern
9

that Youth A’s recent episode of paralysis is secondary to Youth
A’s trauma and possibly psychotogenic in nature.
20th Circuit Court Juvenile court Policy/Procedure
Memorandum Use of Force and De-escalation Interventions
1.37 dated 12/30/24. This document outlines the use of force and
states, only use force when all other less restrictive methods of
behavior control have been attempted and failed. To protect the
youth from injury, to prevent injury to others or to prevent escape.
It is also documented physical restraint of a juvenile is only
permitted after less restrictive techniques have been exhausted
and/or the restraint is necessary based on the following: 1.to
prevent serious injury to the juvenile, self-injury, or to others. 2. As
a precaution against escape where the juvenile may be at risk of
injury to self or others. 3. To prevent the juvenile from causing
substantial property damage that puts in the jeopardy the safe
operations of the facility.
NCI with advanced physical skills training 3rd edition
workbook. This document outlines the techniques that are to be
used when engaging in a restraint with a youth. Since staff
remained in a standing position, the standing hold include
Standing low-level, medium level, and high level restrictions,
Standing shoulders, Standing head, and Standing high-level team
control position. It is documented that staff are to remain standing
with the youth. There is nothing about carrying the youth and in
earlier additions to this 3rd edition it is documented that staff are
not to lift feet or legs off the floor.
HR record for Staff 1 was reviewed. Staff 1 was hired on
10/16/2023. There was no disciplinary action documented in his
personnel file, and he is currently on all required trainings.
Analysis The facility is found in non-compliance as evidence by interviews
with staff, youth, document reviews, and video recording review.
The facility’s policy states restraints are to occur for three specific
situations which are not evidenced to have occurred in the
incident. Staff’s own statements questioned the reason for the
restraint as it did not fall within a required category. Staff
interviewed also reported staff are not trained to carry a youth as
an approved technique and there is nothing in the manual
addressing carrying a youth as a technique.
10

TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE:
Technical Assistance was offered to the facility in the idea of staff
holding each other accountable to engage in only approved
restraint techniques. Any staff observing another staff using an
unapproved restraint or other technique should stop the staff
engaged in the inappropriate technique and have that staff
removed from the situation. This type of action should also be
reported to Administration as soon as possible.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
2023C0000523 dated 7/25/23, CAP approved 8/23/2023
2023C0000308 dated 4/3/23, CAP approved 4/18/23
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
